Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog

Class CourseCatalog

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog.CourseCatalog
public class CourseCatalog extends Object
Class for the course catalog Stores all classes/courses in a catalog and sorts them using a sorted list
Author:
Peyton Herring, Arnva Ganguly, Aaron Green

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseCatalog

      public CourseCatalog()
      Constructs a new blank course catalog

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      This is method that helps us make a 2D String array using the catalog that makes it easier for the GUI to display the catalog It returns an empty array if catalog is null
      Returns:
      courseCatalog thats a 2D string array of the name, section and title of the courses in the catalog

    • newCourseCatalog

      public void newCourseCatalog()
      Creates a new and blank course catalog

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      This method gets the course from the catalog using the parameters
      Parameters:
      name - of the course
      section - of the course
      Returns:
      the course as a Course object or null if the course can't be found

    • addCourseToCatalog

      public boolean addCourseToCatalog(String name, String title, String section, int credits, String instructorId, int enrollmentCap, String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      This method helps add a course to schedule
      Parameters:
      name - of the course to be added
      section - of the course to be added
      title - of the course to be added
      credits - number of credits for the course
      instructorId - instructor of the course
      enrollmentCap - the enrollment capacity of the course
      meetingDays - days the course meets
      startTime - time the course starts
      endTime - time the course ends
      Returns:
      true if the addition was successful, or false if it wasn't
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the course is already added or there's a conflict

    • removeCourseFromCatalog

      public boolean removeCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      removes a course from schedule if name and section are found
      Parameters:
      name - of the course to be removed
      section - of the course to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the course was removed false otherwise

    • loadCoursesFromFile

      public void loadCoursesFromFile(String fileName)
      Reads a file and applies it to catalog
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of file to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if FileNotFound exception is caught meaning the file path is invalid

    • saveCourseCatalog

      public void saveCourseCatalog(String fileName)
      Saves the course catalog to a given file
      Parameters:
      fileName - file to be saved to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the file cannot be saved meaning the file path cannot be found
